critique: This document is an executive order regarding the appointment of Frederick Morgan Davenport to a position in the Civil Service Commission and his designation as a member and Chairman of the Council of Personnel Administration. It's difficult to assess a strong ideological tilt (liberal vs. conservative) based solely on this appointment. It seems more related to administrative functions. Immigration is not addressed. The order itself doesn't dramatically expand executive power, but rather executes existing authority granted by the Civil Service Act. Federalism isn't directly impacted. National security vs. civil liberties isn't a primary concern here. Economic regulation isn't a direct factor. Social inclusion isn't explicitly addressed, although appointments to government positions can indirectly influence diversity.
